Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that "all real estate transactions" will be subject to a 3.8% sales tax, when in reality it only applies to high earners who make more than a certain income threshold.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tax on investment income from real estate transactions is equivalent to a sales tax on all real estate transactions, which is a problematic assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to back up its assertion that the health care law includes a 3.8% sales tax on all real estate transactions.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the tax on investment income, such as the fact that it is intended to fund Medicare and applies only to high earners.
